nav.div: Harvard Public Schools » Departments » District Office » Response to COVID 19

span.style: font-size: 18px;
font-family: Lato; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);

br.span: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC),

span.style: font-family: Lato;
font-family: Lato; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);

span.span: United States federal agency information:

p.style: font-family: "Times New Roman", serif;

span.style: padding: 0in; border: 1pt none windowtext; font-family: Lato; color: rgb(32, 31, 30);

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;

span.style: font-family: Lato;
letter-spacing: 1px; background-color: rgb(219, 229, 241); font-family: latobold; font-size: 18px; color: rgb(40, 40, 40);

a.title: Distance Learning Resources Page
a.style: color: rgb(29, 29, 29); background-color: transparent; box-shadow: rgb(21, 90, 143) 0px 0px 12px 0px; outline: 0px;

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 1.2; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Lato;

p.span: March 31, 2020

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 1.2; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Lato;

p.span: Dear Families of Harvard Students,

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;

span.style: font-family: Lato;
font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

span.span: May this message find you and your families healthy and well during these days of extreme distancing measures. We are in the third week of our school closure, and we sorely miss educating your children and spending the days with them. Instead, we are creating ways to stay connected remotely and still inspire them to

span.style: font-style: italic; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

span.span: access and

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;
font-style: italic; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

span.span: apply knowledge, think critically and creatively, and communicate effectively

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

span.span: as our vision statement highlights. Now, more than ever, we must collaborate with you, the parents or guardians, as you have become active partners in their education.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;

span.style: font-family: Lato;
font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

span.span: We are moving as a district from our Phase 1 plan to our Phase 2 plan. Our Phase 1 plan followed the Education Commissioner’s recommendations to focus on the social connection with students and to provide home engagement opportunities for them to continue learning during the first part of the school closure. As the closure was extended another four weeks, we are moving the district to

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

span.span: Phase 2 beginning April 6

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; white-space: pre-wrap; vertical-align: super;

span.span: th

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

span.span: . In Phase 2 we are making some significant changes, but keeping the

span.style: font-style: italic; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

span.span: balance of academic achievement with personal well-being

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

span.span: at the center of our plan and following the Commissioner’s updated recommendations. You will find his letter attached. Here are the main differences between Phase 1 and 2:

ul.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;

li.style: margin-left: 15px; list-style-type: disc; font-family: "Times New Roman"; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; line-height: 1.2; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-family: Lato;

li.span: The regular education curriculum will move forward at a reduced pace. Teachers are considering their normal 5 day a week schedule of lessons and paring them down to 2 days’ worth. They will teach this new material in a variety of ways.

li.style: margin-left: 15px; list-style-type: disc; font-family: "Times New Roman"; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; line-height: 1.2; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-family: Lato;

li.span: There will be a limited number of assignments related to the new learning that will be required. These assignments will be assessed by the teacher as complete or incomplete and tracked for grade level or course credit.

li.style: margin-left: 15px; list-style-type: disc; font-family: "Times New Roman"; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; line-height: 1.2; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-family: Lato;

li.span: The teachers will communicate a summary of the week with you by noon every Monday so that you know what your child has as required learning and, if appropriate, a schedule of special education services.

li.style: margin-left: 15px; list-style-type: disc; font-family: "Times New Roman"; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; line-height: 1.2; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-family: Lato;

li.span: The teachers will continue to provide additional extension, enrichment, and review resources that will be optional. These resources will be part of the weekly communication from teachers.

li.style: margin-left: 15px; list-style-type: disc; font-family: "Times New Roman"; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; line-height: 1.2; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-family: Lato;

li.span: Students will be supported in their work by the teachers, special educators, district tutors, and learning assistants, as needed. If your child receives additional services, those teachers will also share information each week.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Lato;

p.span: We envision the Phase 2 plan still accommodating a variety of family circumstances including working parents, multi-children homes, and more. We also took your feedback into consideration as we developed this plan. We are striving to include non-device based activities wherever possible. However, due to the limitation of the current situation, we will need to use technology to allow for distance communication and some learning activities. If you need support with the technology, please reach out to your teachers or Principal.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Lato;

p.span: In the recent feedback form many of you shared that you are using this unexpected family time to enjoy more board games, family dinners, nature hikes, and more sleep. One family wrote, “We have been enjoying the slower pace! Kids are getting enough sleep, we are getting out into nature, leisurely dinners without commutes or sports, board games...General family connection.” We hope that all of our children look back at this time of their lives and see adults making sacrifices to keep them safe while helping them learn and enjoy opportunities that may not have been possible with the regular routines. We can provide this for them as we partner together.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Lato;

p.span: As always, please contact the teachers, the Principals, or me with any questions or concerns.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Lato;

p.span: Sincerely,

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Lato;

p.span: Linda G. Dwight

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 1.2; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Lato;

p.span: Superintendent, Harvard Public Schools

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 1.2; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Lato;

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Lato;

p.span: Dear Families of Harvard Students,

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;

span.style: font-family: Lato;
font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

span.span: By now many of you will have heard that the school closure has extended until at least May 4th

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

span.span: . The Governor made this announcement yesterday in his press briefing. We have been anticipating this decision and planning for the next phase of our home engagement with students and parents. While planning, we have been mindful of the variety of circumstances families find themselves in during this unprecedented time. Some of our families have two parents still working outside of the home while others have moved their offices into the home. Some have sick family members who require additional care. Some have increased financial concerns and stress. With all of these different circumstances, the capacity for structured learning time and access and mastery of the curriculum varies per child and per family.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Lato;

p.span: For the past week, we have followed the guidance from the Commissioner of Education, Jeff Riley, and provided extension, enrichment, and review of curriculum that had already been taught. The focus was on providing learning opportunities and maintaining a connection between teachers and students. The assignments were optional and ungraded. This approach was a surprise to some who have wondered why the district did not move the curriculum forward or provide remote lessons for students. Commissioner Riley, along with other educational leaders in MA, had decided this first approach was best for a short-term closure.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Lato;

p.span: Now that we know there are over five more weeks to the school closure, we are planning to pivot to Phase 2. In Phase 2, there will be a forward movement of the curriculum at some slower pace with recognition that we will not be replicating full school days. The students will be required to demonstrate their understanding by handing in some completed work to their teachers for feedback and complete/incomplete grading. The teachers will present new concepts in a variety of ways, providing support and guidance.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Lato;

p.span: We are again requesting your patience as we finalize the details of Phase 2 and will share the plan with you at the beginning of next week. Teaching remotely and providing distance support is new to all of us. Just organizing communication has been a learning experience. We appreciate the support and collaboration you have shown to us as we continue to strive to provide the very best educational experience for your children. We are truly, more than ever, in this journey together. Please reach out to us with your questions and feedback.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;

span.style: font-family: Lato;
font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

span.span: To help us gather more input from parents we have developed this brief form. Please provide us with your thoughts as we move forward.

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Lato;

p.span: Sincerely,

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Lato;

p.span: Linda G. Dwight

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 1.2; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Lato;

p.span: Superintendent, Harvard Public Schools

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;

span.style: font-family: Lato;

div.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;

span.style: font-family: Lato;

p.span: Dear Families of Harvard Students,

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;

span.style: font-family: Lato;

p.span: The teachers, support staff, and leaders have been preparing ways to provide connections to students and families and to support continued learning. We have collaborated with the Department of Education and leaders from other districts with attention to equity and access, and with an understanding that families within our district have differing home circumstances.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;

span.style: font-family: Lato;

p.span: With all of this in mind, each teacher has prepared some resources and activities for your student to complete independently. There will be options for students. Please discuss the amount of work to be completed during the course of a week with your children. Teachers will provide recommendations, and then feedback for any completed activities. They will begin this week by contacting you with the specifics. Between Wednesday afternoon and Friday, you should receive an email from them.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;

span.style: font-family: Lato;

p.span: In order to streamline our communication with you, we are creating a link on our main website at psharvard.org. Here you will find communication organized by grade/teacher. Teachers will update this weekly. This will be especially helpful if you have several children across grade levels. We want to make these resources as helpful as possible and not add to the stress of any family.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;

span.style: font-family: Lato;

p.span: We recognize the hardships on families at this uncertain time especially with the change in routines. Please utilize the services of our counseling department, if needed (HES, TBS). Also, please contact the school nurse by e-mail (cnigzus@psharvard.org, dfrench@psharvard.org) if any member of your family contracts the COVID-19 virus. Your family’s health details will be kept confidential, but the information will help us in planning the reopening of school.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;

span.style: font-family: Lato;

p.span: The school buildings will be fully closed starting Wednesday, March 18th at 3 PM. This closure provides every employee the social distancing needed to help slow down the spread of COVID-19. Please note that HES Parent-Teacher conferences will also be postponed until our return to school. During the closure, please reach out to your child’s teacher via email with any questions related to the classwork or to the Principals and me for any other issues.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;

span.style: font-family: Lato;

p.span: We will remain closed through April 6th with a tentative return date of April 7th. Thank you for your patience and understanding as we plan for continued learning during this school closure. We will continue to monitor information from the CDC, Department of Health, and Department of Elementary and Secondary Education, and keep you informed on plans for returning to school, including if April break will be impacted and if we become aware of confirmed COVID-19 cases that may have impacted your children at school.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;

span.style: font-family: Lato;

p.span: We wish your family health and wellness.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;

span.style: font-family: Lato;

p.span: Sincerely,

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;

span.style: font-family: Lato;

p.span: Linda G. Dwight, Ed. D.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;

span.style: font-family: Lato;

p.span: Superintendent, Harvard Public Schools

p.style: font-family: "Times New Roman", serif;

span.style: padding: 0in; border: 1pt none windowtext; font-family: Lato; color: rgb(32, 31, 30);

p.style: font-family: "Times New Roman", serif;

span.style: padding: 0in; border: 1pt none windowtext; font-weight: inherit; font-stretch: inherit; font-style: inherit; font-family: Lato; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);

p.span: Yesterday Governor Baker announced that all Massachusetts Public Schools will be closed until April 6, 2020, with a potential return on April 7, 2020. This is a result of evolving data and newly released guidelines from the CDC. The Harvard Public School District will continue to monitor this rapidly changing landscape concerning the Coronavirus.

p.style: font-family: "Times New Roman", serif;

span.style: padding: 0in; border: 1pt none windowtext; font-weight: inherit; font-stretch: inherit; font-style: inherit; font-family: Lato; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);

p.span: To support continued learning, students may come to pick up personal items or materials if needed today, March 16th until 3 PM or Tuesday, March 17th between 8 AM and 2 PM. If you do come in, we ask that you still practice social distancing and do not linger in the buildings.

p.style: font-family: "Times New Roman", serif;

span.style: padding: 0in; border: 1pt none windowtext; font-weight: inherit; font-stretch: inherit; font-style: inherit; font-family: Lato; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);

p.span: We are working with teachers and staff to provide resources and materials for families to continue learning and remain connected to teachers during this closure. Further details will be posted on the district website and sent out to families by Wednesday.

p.style: font-family: "Times New Roman", serif;

span.style: font-weight: inherit; font-stretch: inherit; font-style: inherit; font-family: Lato; color: inherit;
padding: 0in; border: 1pt none windowtext; font-weight: inherit; font-stretch: inherit; font-style: inherit; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);

span.span: We are aware that some families rely on the school for free or reduced lunch services. Chef Paul and his staff are contacting families and providing meals as needed. If you would like to help families with food insecurity we recommend donating to Loaves and Fishes

span.style: padding: 0in; border: 1pt none windowtext; color: rgb(32, 31, 30);

a.style: color: rgb(149, 79, 114); font-weight: inherit; font-stretch: inherit; font-style: inherit;

span.style: font-weight: inherit; font-stretch: inherit; font-style: inherit; color: rgb(17, 85, 204);

p.style: font-family: "Times New Roman", serif;

span.style: font-weight: inherit; font-stretch: inherit; font-style: inherit; font-family: Lato; color: inherit;
padding: 0in; border: 1pt none windowtext; font-weight: inherit; font-stretch: inherit; font-style: inherit; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);

span.span: These are unprecedented events and we are working to meet the needs of families as best as we can. As we do, please be patient and work with us to make the best of this situation. We found this letter from a parent expresses this hope well:

span.style: padding: 0in; border: 1pt none windowtext; color: rgb(32, 31, 30);

a.style: color: rgb(149, 79, 114); font-weight: inherit; font-stretch: inherit; font-style: inherit;

span.style: font-weight: inherit; font-stretch: inherit; font-style: inherit; color: rgb(17, 85, 204);

p.style: font-family: "Times New Roman", serif;

span.style: padding: 0in; border: 1pt none windowtext; font-weight: inherit; font-stretch: inherit; font-style: inherit; font-family: Lato; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);

p.span: Finally, parents please help us by stressing the importance to children of all ages of practicing social distancing and limiting playdates. While we do not have any confirmed cases of COVID 19 in our school community, we are aware of parents waiting for test results and we will update you as we learn more. Please resist any travel plans such as what might occur during regular school vacations. Collectively families, schools, and communities can slow the spread of COVID 19 by following all CDC recommendations.

p.style: font-family: "Times New Roman", serif;

span.style: padding: 0in; border: 1pt none windowtext; font-weight: inherit; font-stretch: inherit; font-style: inherit; font-family: Lato; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);

p.span: Regards,

p.style: font-family: "Times New Roman", serif;

span.style: padding: 0in; border: 1pt none windowtext; font-weight: inherit; font-stretch: inherit; font-style: inherit; font-family: Lato; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);

p.span: Linda G. Dwight, Ed.D.

p.style: font-family: "Times New Roman", serif;

span.style: padding: 0in; border: 1pt none windowtext; font-weight: inherit; font-stretch: inherit; font-style: inherit; font-family: Lato; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);

p.span: Superintendent, Harvard Public Schools

div.div:
39 Massachusetts Avenue, Harvard, MA 01451
Phone 978-456-4140 | Fax 978-456-8592

div.span: Please know that it is the policy of the Harvard Public Schools not to discriminate on the basis of race, color, sex, gender identity, religion, national origin, age, disability, or sexual orientation in its educational programs, activities or employment policies as required by Title IX of the 1972 Educational Amendments, Chapter 199, and Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973.
Website by SchoolMessenger Presence. © 2020 Intrado Corporation. All rights reserved.
